posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Kensai means "Sword Saint" in Japanese and it is the title that only the masters of the sword, those that are devoted in all their life to sharpen thir skills with it, eventually get.

They are often well educated - religious persons too, studying a lot and trying to improve in all of their aspects.

And when the time for battle has come nothing is to be feared more than the naked blade of a Kensai...


* This is an RP character of short i made for my avatar Doji Seo while i was playing on WoG. It is primarily designed to be very effective against any type of opponents and to be extremly playable from start to finish, virtually having no weaknesses.

But most of all, i wanted a character that would bring a smile on my face every single time i was playing her. Bringing in the concept of a Kensai i can imagine nothing less than a Katana or a Greatsword (Odachi or NoDachi as it is called) to be acceptable

and of course suh a character could not have low saves or only a few skills, she should have many options to choose from (remember the strive for excellence).

The closest character i have found is the one made by Camiryn back then, named also "Kensai" but even that had too few Monk levels for what i wanted.

What i wanted was the "perfect self" class feauture - resembling the heightened state such blademasters get before a fight, i wanted the best possible ammount of SR i could squize in, and lastly i wanted to reflect things like extreme focus on paper and in play.

Thus a character that is almost impossible to knockdown/disarm was born, versed in a variaty of skills, with strong saves, that transcends the mundane boundaries and elevates into something else, something better.

Almost impossible to watch, Dodji Seo darted from enemy to enemy cleaving her way to forty in the fastest of ways, huge criticals, dazzling speed, knockdown after critical after whirlwind attacks, she eliminated all in her path in a race to ascension.

And she always brought a smile to my face.


** Whilst this is an RP character the same build can be optimized far from it. You can gain as much as 3 more AB with the same build and 4 extra damage/ attack simply by changing her starting stats.

If you wish you can trnasform her into the cousin of Hulk (half-Orc) forget the save booster prer-epic and take the glorious farm implement (scythe), get rid of the ESF in Discipline and take an additional great strength and then unleash some monster

that crits for plus 300 easily while you still have all the rest bonusses. AC will be reduced only by 1, fortitude by 2 and you will loose some hp's. By all means do that if you want, this build purpose from the start was to be extremely flexible and there are

enough feats & skills to accommodate to your individual needs.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Totally missed that thread Mick, although i am acquinted with Ko' di 's Blademaster.

Let me put my 2 coppers into what i think for the Monk/ WM/ FTR combo's here instead, since it is relevant.


Having only 6 levels of Monk does no good man except on special cases, unlike the FTR/WM/RG combo the Monk investment requires more levels to pay off. What do you typically take with 6 Monk levels?

Cleave, Evasion and IKD, and you are able to wear the Sun Soul boots and use special gloves in case they have a special buff into them like we have on WoG for example. And kamas of course eh.

What 5 levels of Rogue gives you instead? UMD which means you can use all these and much much more, evasion, and 3d6 of sneak attack, and trappfinding.

Now IKD from Monk could be really useful if we could put a 10 in INT and be done with it, but we cannot. We need 13 INT & DEX just for the requirements. So the chances are that we usually can and will take IKD ourselves anyway.


Instead of taking the minimum levels of Monk to make a Blademaster, the strength of the class when it is used in this combo, is revealed when we use many more levels, more Monk gives us more special abilities.

Having 9 levels already gives you Improved Evasion which is good but hardly what we really need. Taking 13 levels we become immune to poisons and take some early spell resistance but we are not there yet.

Taking 18 levels you can dublicate the improved Invisibility twice a day and it is undispellable. Now taking twenty levels you get the Mind - effects Immunity which is a really nice ability. Now that's special!


So what is the optimal split in case we powergame as much as possible and we wanted to be something different from the rogue combo's ?

Let me tell you the answer since i have Dodji's Build in no less than six different alterations. Monk 20/ Fighter 4/ WM 16. That's it. With this spread you can have something distinguished and with really good AB.

Is it worth it though? Probably if you play in a server that you spend much time close to forty. For ease of play and constant performance though Monk 25/ WM 7/ FTR 8 would be my choice every time.

What else that combo give us you ask? More speed which is really nice to have since you can escape time stops, taunts, can IKD mages before they know you are there e.t.c and more AC as well, +5 AC to be specific.

That is why i have settled with that split in case of my blademaster. Having +5 AC, All Monk special abilities, some good 35 SR, and a really nice 80% speed buff is definitely worth it for me.

All of these matter in low to medium magical environment such as "WoG", "Kharindale" or "The North" for example.


Power wise as you said the build isn't optimized although you can change that easily still maintaining the same build.

Start with STR (18) DEX (14) CON (10) INT (14) WIS (08) CHA (08) and replace the ESF in Discipline with another GR. STR feat. There, 45 AB whilst still Human with zero exp penalties.

Monk don't get a negative AC for starting with 08 WIS, so AC is down by 1 only. AB is 2 more and DMG is plus 3.


As an answer to your thread i would say that either Monk 10/12 or Monk 20/25 would be my final choices depending on the environment and my necessities for more AB.

And the point is that having only a handful of Monk levels isn't worth the trouble unless you like Kama's, i would go with Rogue is such cases.


Thanks for your input and suggestions man!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey man!

Well, I disagree that 20 levels for the Mind Effects immunities are worth the investment (it's 14 levels you're investing, man!). I understand your thought process, but I don't think it applies to my playstyle. I'd probably be more inclined to go for a Kama-wielding Monk 9 / WM 19 / Fighter 12 or Monk 6 / WM 22 / Fighter 12 (the bad thing here being waiting till level 37 to get IKD). I don't know what a NoDachi is, so I can't say anything about that, but I can say this: you could drop Great Fortitude and Fighter for CoT levels. You'd lose 6 damage, which is hardly a problem for this build, but you'd gain +1 Fort, +4 Will and +4 Reflex and 2 feats, which could be taken in pre-epics or epics, in pre-epics you could take Disarm / Improved Disarm and in epics you could add two Great Strengths by rearranging things a bit.

I'm saying this because I think CoT is a better fit RP-wise for a sword saint (champion of a god or a cause x just a plain warrior) and it does give you some nice boosts that are about 50-50 with the Fighter's WS / EWS contribution to the build. Without Fighter you'd need to rearrange your feats and levels and delay WM a little, but I think it'd be worth the trade.

Other than that, another nice speedy truck !

Take it EZ!

The "Whirlwind of Steel", whoa, this brings back memories... One of my first commissions in the guild and one build i really loved back in the day. For a naturally agressive player like myself having all impportant factors in one build was a godsend. Natural (32) Strength plus a Greatsword plus weapon master's criticals plus insane speed boost from monk meant serious business and i played this build in both Aielund saga & WoG with great success. I would not do PvP with this character thought, there are others more suited to this task...

Now to proceed and clear some misunderstandings here...
A Dai-Katana OR a ZweiHander OR an O-Dachi is the same very thing as your beloved and known to all of you Greatsword. Or else you would have seen a feat for exotic weapons somewhere in there. Now some of the modules or PW's incorporate the famous CEP 2.3 in them and allow for visual modifications of the swords as to look like a katana or anything else but the weapon is the same in every factional way and the build works flawlessly with that.

I hope that helped, and no-i do not play- Nwn2 since it shares very little to the Original game that i loved.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
First to address the issue of Greatsword Vs Katana OR in general Two-Hander Vs One-Hander for this build.

I will be the first to admit that Blackened Skies-Burning Earth (please correct me if i am wrong) is a wonderful weapon and the exotic nature of the Katana as a weapon fits even more to the theme of "Whirlwind of Steel" than the No-Dachi (Greatsword). And considering that Aielund itself forbids the use of Dev-Critical feat you certainly have the necessary feats available to take "Exotic Weapons" and use it. However, that would be a flat-out downgrade to your damage as Kensai. You see, even though Katanas in Aielund are somewhat more powerful than other weapons, they still can't compare to the multiplication by 1.5 times of your entire (enhanced in the game) strength. Having said that, if you want to use a Katana as your Kensai's weapon of choise, you can surely take it, there are available feats for that, i am just here to note the differences and warn you of the outcome. And do not forget that the No-Dachi (Greatsword) has better base damage, does not require an extra feat and even has better reach in-game (proven by Hip). That being said i am sure you will do fine in Aielund either way Stag ;)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
lilapocalypse59 wrote: Hello, I was just wondering if there was a skill schedule for the Human kensai build? Im not confident enough in myself to know the best layout for the skills so pardon for asking lol
Hi lilapocalypse59 (may I just call you lil from now on, it's so much easier on the keyboard, please?)

Unfortunately (but happily), there are several variants of the build in this thread, so before any furnishing can be given, are you talking about the initial build or the Aielund-specific one?

Essentially, though - and in either case - maximize your Discipline on every level (so 4 at level 1 and 1 every next level), because all 3 of these classes have that as a skill. Only take Concentration when either Fighter or Monk classes are being taken, and only take Tumble, Hide and Move Silently when taking a Monk class (it may be better to think of Tumble as bundles of 5 ranks each time you take it). You will need to cross-class Intimidate and Spellcraft, because neither are available to Fighter or Monk as class skills, and you need the Intimidate ranks before you can take WM. That means you can take only 2 ranks in the skill at level 1 rather than the usual 4, then you can drop the other 2 in (excluding levels 3, 4 and 5) before starting your WM levels. Similarly, Spellcraft is only available on alternate levels, and costs 2 points for every one you allocate. Heal is only there for niceness - if you're struggling, take it later.

I hope this makes a bit of sense at least.

And welcome aboard, lil!

I wish I had seen this thread two weeks ago.  I got the bright idea to build a "Sohei" (Warrior Monk) and M25/FTR8/WM7 popped into my mind immediately.  Mine is less powerful because he's wielding a naginata (halberd, which I read was a favored weapon of soheis) and I'm building for Dev Crit.

Currently in HOTU at FTR 5/MON 6/WM 5.  My LVL 20 split will be MON 8/WM 7/ FTR 5.
